channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-3379] [client] Auth token cache file name should include OOZIE_URL
item.description:
We have a program that connects to multiple Oozie clusters with multiple AuthOozieClient instances, which frequently request the KDC server because the authentication token cache is invalid.

After some investigation we found that the auth token cache file is incorrectly shared by all AuthOozieClient instances. Therefore, we propose that the auth token cache file name include Oozie URL as postfix.
item.summary: [client] Auth token cache file name should include OOZIE_URL

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Thanks for the contribution zuston!

A couple of comments:

  1. file length should be trimmed to 255 chars
  2. if there is already a File with the same name, at least LOG.warn()
  3. new unit test cases covering the new functionality should be created, explicitly testing for multiple AuthOozieClient instances in one JVM
  4. instead of public static File, the auth token cache should be @VisibleForTesting final File that could be asserted in a unit test. In a JVM we can have multiple AuthOozieClient instances w/ multiple Oozie URLs, that's also why we should not use static here
PreCommit-OOZIE-Build started

Testing JIRA OOZIE-3379

Cleaning local git workspace

----------------------------

-1 Patch failed to apply to head of branch

----------------------------
Thank Andras Prios for giving me some suggestions! I have reuploaded the patch.

zuston to address the one remaining FindBugs warning, can you please put following annotation on the actual method (constructor) level (AuthOozieClient.java#L93-100):

@SuppressFBWarnings(value = "PATH_TRAVERSAL_IN", justification = "FilenameUtils is used to filter user input. JDK8+ is used.")

Can you please also add following FilenameUtils#getName() call when creating a new File given user input like this:

FilenameUtils.getFullPath(System.getProperty("user.home")) + FilenameUtils.getName(filename)
Thanks andras.piros. OOZIE-3379-8.patch has been submitted.
